description: Stormbringer is a weekly hobby magazine from Hachette Partworks introducing players to Warhammer: Age of Sigmar. In this 80-week series, our intrepid magazine-receiver will be reviewing each individual issue, its included models, and gaming materials. A Premium US subscription was provided to Goonhammer for review purposes. If you want to follow along at home, US […]
title: SRM’s Ongoing Stormbringer Review: Week 22

description: The Hextech line of pre-painted 6mm terrain from Gale Force 9 is expanding, and we're reviewing the most recent releases.
title: Hextech Terrain for Battletech Wave 3: The Goonhammer Review

description: We are proud to announce the 2024 US Goonhammer Open! As with previous years, the GHO will be held in Maryland. Come join us on July 6th and 7th. Like a rolling stone, we are moving yet again! This time we have landed at the Sheraton Baltimore Washington Airport in Linthicum. You can get tickets for the […]
title: Announcing the 2024 US Goonhammer Open in Baltimore, Maryland

description: The Unified Tournament Circuit is a regional circuit for Warhammer 40k and Age of Sigmar which covers the area between Virginia and Newfoundland. In case you missed our announcement, you can find it here. You can find the full calendar of UTC events here. Last Weekend’s Event A light sprinkling of AoS and 40k […]
title: UTC Weekend Recap and Preview: April 25

description: The Grand Larceny deck is one of 4 preconstructed Commander decks released alongside the Outlaws of Thunder Junction set. It’s a Sultai (Black, Blue, and Green) color identity deck built around doing combat damage and stealing your opponents’ stuff when you do so.   Upgrading the Deck Is this deck the most powerful, either out […]
title: Unstable Mutation: Grand Larceny Upgrade (Outlaws of Thunder Junction Commander)

description: Join us as we take a closer look and play a demo game of Halo: Flashpoint.
title: Halo: Flashpoint – First Impressions

description: Welcome back, Dear Reader, to my ongoing chronicle of competitive and hobby progress in Warhammer 40,000 for 2024. Last time around I talked about my trip to England and my first day of games at the Oxford GT. Today I’m going to talk about day two and the rest of the trip, and talk about […]
title: TheChirurgeon’s Road Through 2024, Part 8: The Oxford GT (Part Two)

description: Well, here we are. Fifty articles, dozens of votes, and more than a month later, we’ve finally arrived at our final matchup. And even though we were determined to look at more than just video games, it was always going to be these two – 1998 and 2004 were phenomenal years for gaming, each filled with a […]
title: The Best Year in Gaming: The Final Matchup
